meanings.definition: Fluctuational: relating to or characterized by fluctuations
meanings.sent1: The fluctuational weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was fluctuational, sometimes happy and sometimes sad.
meanings.sent3: The fluctuational prices at the store kept customers guessing.
meanings.sent4: Life is like a fluctuational wave, with ups and downs.
meanings.sent5: The fluctuational pattern of the stars fascinated astronomers.

meanings.definition: Fluctuational: subject to change or variation
meanings.sent1: His opinion on the matter was fluctuational, never staying the same.
meanings.sent2: The stock market is fluctuational, with prices constantly changing.
meanings.sent3: The fluctuational traffic made her late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Love can be as fluctuational as the tides of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the fluctuational colors of the sunset in her painting.

meanings.definition: Fluctuational: fluctuating or varying in nature
meanings.sent1: The fluctuational energy levels of the child made it hard to keep up.
meanings.sent2: The river's fluctuational flow depended on the rainfall.
meanings.sent3: His fluctuational singing voice surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fluctuational emotions of the character added depth to the story.
meanings.sent5: The fluctuational patterns in the sand were created by the wind.
